summary: This document is an email chain from September 2020 between the FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit and the UK's National Crime Agency (NCA). The NCA is providing financial intelligence related to Jeffrey Epstein and inquiring about a potential internal investigation into an individual named IVEAGH. It highlights international law enforcement cooperation and the sharing of financial data via FinCEN.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the FBI/DOJ investigation for which the UK's National Crime Agency is sharing financial intelligence.

persons.name: Jimenez
persons.role: Deputy Assistant Director - Branch II, FBI Criminal Investigative Division
persons.context: FBI official copied on emails regarding the dissemination of information related to the Epstein investigation. Previously worked in Branch I.

persons.name: Paul Jenkins
persons.role: Head of the Western Hemisphere region for NCA
persons.context: Head of the NCA's Western Hemisphere region, copied on the correspondence as a point of contact.

persons.name: Kevin B. Neely
persons.context: FBI official copied on the initial email dissemination from the NCA.

connections.description: The NCA email inquires if an internal investigation into IVEAGH would affect the FBI's Epstein investigation and mentions having financial intelligence on Epstein, suggesting a potential financial or investigative link.
Law enforcement counterparts coordinating the sharing of intelligence between the FBI and the UK's National Crime Agency regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: FBI/NCA Meeting
events.description: A meeting referenced as having occurred in January 2020 between the FBI and the UK's National Crime Agency regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: NCA Dissemination to FBI
events.description: The UK's National Crime Agency sends formal dissemination (NCAWAS-20-081 and NCAWAS-20-001) to the FBI regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: NCA Inquiry on IVEAGH and Financial Intel
events.description: The NCA inquires if an internal investigation into IVEAGH would affect the FBI's Epstein probe and offers to route financial intelligence on Epstein via FinCEN.

events.title: Financial Intelligence Marked for Dissemination
events.description: The NCA confirms financial intelligence on Epstein has been marked for dissemination to the FBI unit via FinCEN.

locations: British Embassy, 3100 Massachusetts Avenue NW, Washington, DC 20008
keyFacts: The UK's National Crime Agency (NCA) was actively sharing financial intelligence related to Jeffrey Epstein with the FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit in 2020.
The NCA inquired whether an internal investigation into an individual named 'IVEAGH' would adversely affect the FBI's Epstein investigation, suggesting a potential link.
Financial intelligence on Epstein was being routed through the US Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) by the NCA.
The email chain demonstrates ongoing international law enforcement cooperation in the Epstein case years after his death.
